title: Choose the Correct Negation Particle
instruction: Select the correct negation particle to complete each sentence from classical Buddhist texts.

questions.question: Complete: གཟུགས ___ སྐྱེ། (Form does not arise.) [Heart Sutra]

options.transliteration: ma — negates past verbs or prohibitions

questions.hint: སྐྱེ (to arise) is a present tense verb. Which particle negates present tense?

questions.question: Complete: རྒྱལ་སྲས་ཀྱིས་ཉོན་མོངས་ལ་དབང ___ བྱིན། (The bodhisattva did not give power to the afflictions.) [37 Practices]
questions.transliteration: rgyal sras kyis nyon mongs la dbang ___ byin
questions.english: The bodhisattva did not give power to the afflictions.
questions.hint: བྱིན (gave) is the past stem of སྦྱིན. Which particle negates past tense?

questions.question: Complete: སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་ལ་མིག ___ (In emptiness there are no eyes.) [Heart Sutra]
questions.english: In emptiness there are no eyes.
questions.hint: We are negating the existence of eyes. Which particle negates existence (the opposite of ཡོད)?

questions.question: Complete: འདི་ནི་ཆོས ___ (This is not dharma.)
questions.hint: We are saying 'this IS NOT dharma' — negating identity. Which particle negates ཡིན (to be)?

questions.question: Complete: ཉོན་མོངས་ཀྱི་དབང་དུ ___ སོང༌། (Do not fall under the power of the afflictions!) [37 Practices]
questions.transliteration: nyon mongs kyi dbang du ___ song
questions.english: Do not fall under the power of the afflictions!
questions.hint: This is a command — 'don't go!' Which particle forms prohibitions (negative imperatives)?

correctFeedback: Correct! You can distinguish between the four negation particles: མི (present/future), མ (past/prohibition), མིན (identity), མེད (existence).
incorrectFeedback: Review: མི negates present/future verbs, མ negates past verbs and forms prohibitions, མིན negates identity (is not), མེད negates existence (does not exist).
